attributes.action: Allow outdoor tennis to continue during the second lockdown
attributes.additional_details:
Tennis maintains above a safe distance between players.
Proven to enhance working memory and cognitive performance, tennis is key in alleviating the psychological strain on individuals working from home.
Recently, the use of tennis courts has substantially increased, indicating that it is a popular way to engage in physical activity when visiting gyms is unsafe. 
Foremost, tennis is mostly played by single households or individuals in a support bubble who are likely to meet outdoors regardless.
attributes.background: We are challenging the decision to shut outdoor tennis courts during the November 2020 lockdown. The benefits of allowing tennis courts to open outweigh the potential risk of players contracting the virus. With the right measures in place, outdoor tennis venues could be safely reopened.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign some of these petitions:

Allow indoor/outdoor tennis courts to operate under strict distancing protocols: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/557428

Exempt outdoor tennis from closure due to COVID-19: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/557658
